document.docAuthor: Likhitrakarn, Natdanai, Golovatch, Sergei I. & Panha, Somsak
document.docTitle: Nepalella siamensis Likhitrakarn & Golovatch & Panha 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Oriental millipede genus Nepalella Shear, 1979, with the description of a new species from Thailand and an updated key (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida, Megalotylidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Oriental millipede genus Nepalella Shear, 1979, with the description of a new species from Thailand and an updated key (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida, Megalotylidae)

Abbreviations: b basal process, cg coxal gland, m medial process, mp mushroom-shaped protuberance, p parabasal process, h horn-shaped process. Scale bars: 0.25 mm.

Nepalella siamensis sp. nov., SEM ♂ holotype (CUMZ) A, B anterior gonopods, caudal and superior views, respectively C, E posterior gonopods, front and caudal views, respectively D, F left gonopod, front and caudal views, respectively. Abbreviations: c colpocoxite, cl lateral lobe, cxi coxites, ll lateral lobules, ml median lobe, r rounded bulge, t 1 telopoditomere 1, t 2 telopoditomere 2. Scale bars: 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype.

♂ (CUMZ), Thailand, Sa Kaeo Province, Ta Phraya District, Ta Phraya National Park, 183 m a.s.l., 14°08'22"N , 102°40'11"E , 27.10.2010, leg. N. Likhitrakarn and S.I. Golovatch. The holotype of
Nepalella siamensis
sp. nov. is housed in the Museum of Zoology, Chulalongkorn University (CUMZ), Bangkok, Thailand.
Etymology.
To emphasize "Siam" , referring to the former name of Thailand as the terra typica ; adjective.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis.

Figure 3.
Nepalella siamensis

subSubSection.paragraph: Description.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 4.
Nepalella siamensis
sp. nov., ♂ holotype (CUMZ) A, B anterior gonopods, front and caudal views, respectively C, D posterior gonopods, caudal and front views, respectively. Abbreviations: c colpocoxite, cl lateral lobe, cxi coxites, ll lateral lobules, ml median lobe, r rounded bulge, t1 telopoditomere 1, t2 telopoditomere 2. Scale bars: 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: In width, collum <segment 2 <3 <head with genae = segment 4 <5 <6 <7 = 20; thereafter, body very gradually tapering towards telson.
Body with 30 segments (29 pleurotergites with free sternites, plus telson, or "rings" , in terms of Enghoff et al. (1993 , 2015 )).
Antennae very long and slender (Figs 2A , 3A ), reaching past body segment 6 when stretched posteriorly; antennomere 7 with four apical cones.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 5.
Nepalella siamensis
sp. nov., SEM ♂ holotype (CUMZ) A, B anterior gonopods, caudal and superior views, respectively C, E posterior gonopods, front and caudal views, respectively D, F left gonopod, front and caudal views, respectively. Abbreviations: c colpocoxite, cl lateral lobe, cxi coxites, ll lateral lobules, ml median lobe, r rounded bulge, t1 telopoditomere 1, t2 telopoditomere 2. Scale bars: 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remark.

The specimen was collected by hand while it was moving very fast on the leaf litter surface. The type locality is situated in a dipterocarp forest on the side of a road near the Ta Phraya Waterfall. The species was found syntopically together with
Antheromorpha uncinata
(Attems, 1931) ( Paradoxosomatidae , Polydesmida ) ( Likhitrakarn et al. 2016 ).
